page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered by our D-block is one of considerable contrasts. At one end stands{Nostell Priory,}an elegant eighteenth century country house set in beautiful grounds. At the other end of the areas the predominantly mining community of Purston Jaglin Featherstone, characterised by rows of uniform houses and typical of many mining towns in our region. Between these extremes lie acres of farmland amongst which are found quiet hamlets such as West Hardwick and Hessle. The pit head at Ackton Hall Colliery, jutting incongruously up from the surrounding expanse of fields and agricultural land, presents a strange but not untypical feature of this region.
